summary: The document comprises memoranda and contract amendments detailing Edward G. Tichborn's employment as an independent contractor with the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA), including compensation adjustments, termination notices, and amendments related to health insurance, tax obligations, and secrecy agreements. It references the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, suggesting a connection to historical investigations. The contract, effective from 15 October 1954 for two years, outlines terms for travel and operational expenses, repayment obligations, and conditions for termination, alongside personal data of Tichborn, including his duties involving consultation and advice on political techniques under controlled conditions.
key_findings: Edward G. Tichborn was employed as an independent contractor by the CIA, with his contract subject to various amendments over time.
The documents detail compensation adjustments, termination notices, and specific amendments related to health insurance and tax obligations.
A significant portion pertains to the termination of Tichborn's contract, including a 'quit claim' payment.
The documents reference the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, suggesting a link to historical investigations or records related to the assassination.
Secrecy and confidentiality agreements are emphasized, requiring Tichborn to keep all contract and operational information secret.
The contract, effective from 15 October 1954 for two years, details terms for travel and operational expenses, repayment obligations, and conditions for termination.
Includes personal data of Tichborn, such as family relations and salary information, and specifies his duties involving consulting and advising on political techniques under controlled conditions.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
